contentrichtext.text: '''Jefferies tubes,''' in the ''[[Star Trek]]'' [[fictional universe]], are narrow [[tunnel]]s or [[wikt:corridor|corridors]] inside a [[starship]]. They can be [[vertical direction|vertical]]ly or [[horizontal plane|horizontally]] oriented, and form a network that allows [[travel]] throughout large volumes of a starship even when the [[turbolift]]s are not functioning. The term "Jefferies tube" was originally an [[in-joke|inside joke]] among the original ''Star Trek'' production staff, a reference to [[Star Trek: The Original Series|Original Series]] [[art director]] [[Matt Jefferies]], the man who designed the original starship ''[[starship Enterprise|Enterprise]]''.<ref name="STERG">{{cite encyclopedia|encyclopedia=Star Trek Encyclopedia: A Reference Guide to the Future|author=Michael Okuda, Denise Okuda, Doug Drexler, and Debbie Mirek|publisher=Pocket Books|year=1999|isbn=0-671-53609-5|isbn13=9780671536091|article=Jeffries Tube|pages=220}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|title=A Vision of the Future|author=Stephen Edward Poe|publisher=Simon & Schuster|year=1998|isbn=0-671-53481-5|isbn=978-0-671-53481-3|pages=22}}</ref> The term was used frequently throughout ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]'', ''[[Star Trek: Deep Space Nine]]''. and ''[[Star Trek: Voyager]]''. Another in-joke reportedly appearing in the Jefferies tube sets on the original ''Star Trek'' series are labels on the pipes marked "G.N.D.N.". This stands for "Goes Nowhere, Does Nothing." The labels are usually written so small as to be invisible to the audience, but can be seen in certain scenes from the ''Star Trek'' films.<ref name="STERG" /> ==Other uses== [[Scott Adams]] has made references to Jefferies Tubes in his comic strip and animated television series ''[[Dilbert]]''. One such reference was in a March 20, 1996 comic introducing [[Asok (Dilbert character)|Asok the Intern]].<ref name=Asok>[http://dilbert.com/strips/comic/1996-03-20/ Dilbert comic]</ref> A second reference was made on the TV series, S1E7 "Little people", in which Dilbert uses a Jefferies tube to get to the conference room where free food is waiting. [[J. D. Frazer]] also made a reference to Jefferies tubes in his ''[[User Friendly]]'' comic strip.<ref name=UF>[http://ars.userfriendly.org/cartoons/?id=20081126 User Friendly comic]</ref> ==References== <!--See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Footnotes for an explanation of how to generate footnotes using the <ref(erences/)> tags--> {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Memoryalpha}} {{Star Trek}} [[Category:Star Trek terminology]] {{StarTrek-stub}}
